title: Andaru Dongale Dorikithe
descriptions:
**Title:** Andaru Dongale Dorikithe  
**Year:** 1981

A poor farming family struggles to survive in a small village in India. The father, Dongale, and his son, Andaru, dream of a better life. When Dongale loses his land due to a fraudulent transaction by a local moneylender, they are forced to migrate to the city for work. In the city, Andaru finds hope in the form of a skilled carpenter who teaches him a trade. Together, they work hard and eventually open a successful carpentry shop. However, their success is tested when the moneylender, seeking revenge, creates obstacles and tries to repossess their hard-earned property. With the support of their community, Andaru and Dongale fight back, learning valuable lessons about resilience, unity, and the power of dreams.
